title: The more I know about Rune changes, the more I'm excited for S8!
body:
I know they're not even here yet and we might not even enjoy it, but c'mon, it's riot... completely changing the rune system will break the meta for months! Even when they changed masteries, nothing was stale for months! And now the whole runes.
And what kind of runes at that, changing summs during game, improved vision mechanics, a crazy Ghost effect on your boots, etc!
I really love all these changes and I'm totally looking forward to the preseason and the chaos that will ensue!

One thing people fail to realize, and that Riot is testing with, is that if everything is broken, then nothing is broken, because everyone has access to be able to use it if they want to. Dota has this mindset (yes I play a little Dota every now and again). In Dota there is literally a hero with a *10 second stun*. There is another one who's ult does 1000 true damage to a target no matter what, and you can upgrade it to do more damage, and apply that damage to everyone in a small radius. This stuff is not broken compared to some of the stuff I've seen. Maybe it is broken in League's meta, but if we give it time and our approval it will balance out seen enough.

{{champion:85}} *Balance in all things*

You do understand why it works in Dota right?

The reason is the only modifying effects are in game items. Dota has a Vacuum principle wherein Heroes are balanced around all items in game and effects wherein League is much MUCH more variable in champion stats and effects due to the rune/mastery system and soon to be runes reforged. Where they are additional effects outside of the game with these that need to be taken into account and this tips balance out of proportion as these effects can have negative impacts by making a character strong but another useless. Unlike Dota where a change on an item will effect camps alone a change on a mastery/new runes can not be offset by champion changes as it may break the champion with another rune.

That is the reason why league has not gone the route that DOTA does.

You know "balance in all things" is also an Akali quote, right?
